answerText: Memoirs of Hadrian (or Memoires d'Hadrien)[10] Another novel with a Roman emperor as the protagonist is this Robert Graves work. Written as the biography of Caligula's successor, this novel perpetuates the myth that Livia killed everyone to ensure her own children and grandchildren held all power in Rome.
heading: SUBMIT |2014 | Yale A, OSU A | 8 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question:  [10] Name this novel by Marguerite Yourcenar. The narrator of this novel discusses his reign as the "Age of Gold" and talks at length about his Bithynian lover Antinous.
